The CEO is the head of the company and is responsible for the day-to-day operations. The stockholders are the actual owners of the company and have a say in the decisions made by the Board of Directors.

 The Dragon-Boat Festival is an annual event celebrated by Chinese people and other East Asians on the fifth day of the fifth month of the lunar calendar. It is a celebration of the death of the legendary Chinese patriot Qu Yuan, who lived during the Warring States period (475-221 B.C.). According to legend, Qu Yuan was an official of the state of Chu who was so devoted to his country that he tried to warn the emperor about the danger of a possible invasion by the state of Qin. When his warnings were ignored, he committed suicide by throwing himself into the Miluo River. The people of Chu, in an effort to save his soul, took to the river in dragon boats and splashed the water with drums and cymbals in an attempt to scare away the fish and ensure his soul a peaceful journey. In memory of this event, people still take to the
